Class AIPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • Player
      • AIPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class AIPlayer
extends Player
implements java.io.Serializable
    Represents an AI Player, with 4 options for selecting moves. 1. Monte-Carlo Tree Search 2. Limit Opponents move options heuristic 3. Combinatorial Game Theory evaluation 4. Random Choice
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Move getCGTMove​(Board board)
      Returns a move that is chosen using the Combinatorial Game Theory strategy, of evaluating a board into a GameValue, coupled with the endgame database.
      Move getHeuristicMove​(Board board)
      Returns a move chosen using the strategy of giving the opponent the least move options
      Move getMonteCarloMove​(Board board)
      Returns a move chosen using a monte-carlo tree search strategy

      • getCGTMove

        public Move getCGTMove​(Board board)
        Returns a move that is chosen using the Combinatorial Game Theory strategy, of evaluating a board into a GameValue, coupled with the endgame database. Attempts to get a GameValue from the endgame database, if not found then using the Monte-Carlo strategy to return a move instead.
        Parameters:
        board - current board
        Returns:
        selected move

      • getRandomMove

        public Move getRandomMove​(java.util.ArrayList<Move> moves)
        Returns a randomly chosen move, from the list of valid moves
        Parameters:
        moves - List of valid possible moves
        Returns:
        selected move
